@magdalenakala or a podcast
I also think it's fair (and important) to add that Gary has added A LOT of positive influence to NFTs and crypto in general, and it benefits greatly all of us that he keeps doing that

The (sad) reality is that most people in this space are looking for quick cash grabs. Simple as that. And it's not just newcomers, but it's some (most?) of those influencers as well. As long as we keep promoting these projects, we're going to keep fueling that mentality.

For "utility NFTs" - how about we focus on the utility?

If people want to develop a game based on NFT, how about you develop the game first, or god forbid a super early version, before you promote/sell ANYTHING?

While I respect @0x_fxnction for "calling @garyvee  out", and it sounds like that "awareness boost" might've actually been helpful - how about we discuss how to change that narrative? How we set higher standards for new projects?

This is a very thoughtful & intelligent dialogue (which is quite rare in this space) between 2 well-meaning individuals.

More than anything, I believe it exposes the deeper problems in the space, and we should be focused on tackling those. https://t.co/zfdY86Ne6c
